text: Utica () is a city in the Mohawk Valley and the county seat of Oneida County, New York, United States. Its population was 65,283 in the 2020 U.S. census. It is located on the Mohawk River at the foot of the Adirondack Mountains. Utica is about 90 miles (145 km) northwest of Albany and 45 miles (72 km) east of Syracuse. Utica and the nearby city of Rome anchor the Uticaâ€“Rome Metropolitan Statistical Area, which makes up all of Oneida and Herkimer counties. ==References== ==Book sources== * * ==Other websites== * NYPL Digital Gallery, Items related to Utica, NY * Library of Congress, Prints & Photos Division, Items related to Utica, NY * SkyscraperPage, Diagram of skyscrapers in Utica, NY Category:Cities in New York (state) Category:County seats in New York (state)
title: Utica, New York
